title-group.article-title: Does Financial Regulation Enhance or Impede the Efficiency of China's Listed Commercial Banks? A Dynamic Perspective

abstract.p: Unlike studies investigating only the characteristics of bank regulation that affect the concurrent static efficiency of banks, this paper uses a dynamic, slacks-based measure to study the persistent and intertemporal effects on the dynamic efficiency of banks in the long run. The authors find the following main results. First, the cost-to-income ratio has a significant negative effect on bank efficiency. Second, banks having higher loan-to-deposit and current ratios are more efficient than those with lower ratios. Third, the capital adequacy, provision coverage, and loan-loss provision ratios do not significantly affect bank efficiency.

ref.mixed-citation: Release of the Chinese version of Basel III was delayed from January 2012 to the second half of 2012.
DEA models usually impose a monotonie assumption (i.e., when the input increases, output cannot be reduced).
